My only suggestion, in line with the previous posts, would be to update the [introduction of the pod](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/121062-1-0-2-Corvus-Size-1-two-seat-command-pod%28Version-1-0%29?p=1934575&viewfull=1#post1934575). Just stating that heatshield and decoupler are not missing, "use stock versions or kw-rocketry if you like" would be enough.

Two quick questions! Do you plan on adding seats for IVA? Right now the Kerbals are sitting in air. Also, any reason why the docking/parachute cone isn't surface attachable? I can't put lights or antennas on it.

Newest Update is up on the OP. Check out the change log for details. 

Make sure you delete the old version before updating. Also note that the nose might of been tweaked a bit and it could affect craft that are in flight.

> 
> Two quick questions! Do you plan on adding seats for IVA? Right now the Kerbals are sitting in air. Also, any reason why the docking/parachute cone isn't surface attachable? I can't put lights or antennas on it.

Lucky you; asking me before I posted the update. Nose now supports surface attach. The IVA has seats, you need to also install the HGR file included as it contains the props I use. (Like said seats) ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I love this! Just wanted to note one "documentation bug": the Corvus Supply Tank description says it "carries more monopropellant than the standard RCS tank of the same diameter." In fact, it contains 20% less, 200 units vs. 250 in the stock FL-R25. Not that I think that's too little, just noting that the description is incorrect.

Some problems with the new update:

- With the new Corvus heat shield, craft want to turn upside down during reentry. Adding the following (taken from the stock heat shield .cfgs) seems to fix it:

CoPOffset = 0.0, 1.0, 0.0

CoLOffset = 0.0, -0.15, 0.0

- The Corvus no longer flies straight! It always turns towards the horizon at liftoff. The nosecone seems to be the culprit.

- I feel like the ship should be leaning the opposite direction when the parachute is deployed. i.e. the parachute string should not be clipping through the nosecone:

![H7Q8slG.png](http://i.imgur.com/H7Q8slG.png)
